Package space.sunqian.fs.object.convert

Interface ObjectConverter

public interface ObjectConverter
This interface is used to convert an object from the specified type to the target type.

It contains and uses a list of ObjectConverter.Handlers to sequentially attempt conversion. A handler can return ObjectConverter.Status.HANDLER_CONTINUE, ObjectConverter.Status.HANDLER_BREAK or a normal value as the final result. The conversion logic is as follows: 


 for (Handler handler : handlers()) {
     Object ret;
     try {
         ret = handler.convert(src, srcType, target, this, options);
     } catch (Exception e) {
         throw new ObjectConvertException(e);
     }
     if (ret == Status.HANDLER_CONTINUE) {
         continue;
     }
     if (ret == Status.HANDLER_BREAK) {
         throw new UnsupportedObjectConvertException(src, srcType, target, this, options);
     }
     return ret;
 }
 throw new UnsupportedObjectConvertException(src, srcType, target, this, options);

The thread safety of the methods in this interface is determined by its dependent DataMapper, ObjectBuilderProvider, and other objects. By default, they are all thread-safe.

    Handler for ObjectConverter, provides the specific conversion logic.
    static enum

    withFirstHandler(@Nonnull ObjectConverter.Handler handler)
    Returns a new ObjectConverter of which handler list consists of the given handler as the first element, followed by handlers() of the current converter.
    default @Nonnull ObjectConverter
    withLastHandler(@Nonnull ObjectConverter.Handler handler)
    Returns a new ObjectConverter of which handler list consists of handlers() of the current converter, followed by the given handler as the last element.

    • convert

      default <T> T convert(@Nullable @Nullable Object src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<? extends T> target, @Nonnull @Nonnull Option<?,?> @Nonnull ... options) throws UnsupportedObjectConvertException, ObjectConvertException
      Converts the given source object from the specified type to the target type.

      The options parameter can be empty, in which case the default behavior will be used, or built-in options in ConvertOption or other custom options for custom implementations.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the target type
      Parameters:
      src - the given source object
      target - the specified type of the target object
      options - the other conversion options
      Returns:
      the converted object, null is permitted
      Throws:
      UnsupportedObjectConvertException - if the conversion from the specified type to the target type is not supported
      ObjectConvertException - if the conversion failed
